title: Chinese Style Barbecue Sauce
ingredients: 2 cups light brown sugar, firmly packed
6 tablespoons chili paste with garlic (available at Oriental markets)
instructions: In a large heavy stainless steel or enameled saucepan cook 4½ cups onion, chopped, 6 garlic cloves, minced, in 2 sticks (1 cup) of unsalted butter over low heat, stirring, for 15 minutes, or until the onions are softened.  Add 3 cups tomato purée, 2 cups firmly packed light brown sugar, ¾ cups each of soy sauce and rice vinegar, and 6 tablespoons chili paste and simmer the sauce, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
remarks: You may wish to cut down the spicy element, the chili paste.  Barring the availability of chili paste you may wish to substitute cayenne pepper, but be judicious, you don’t want to make the ribs so spicy that you don’t enjoy them.
source: Cuisine Courante:  A Bachelor Dinner, Gourmet Magazine, June 1981.
